Package com.cafean.jobstream.common

Class TerminateContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.jobstream.common.TerminateContext
  • public class TerminateContext
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple object encapsulating a request to terminate the job with the given batch ID.

    Note that though the job stream name and relative location are included in the context, the task name and location are not due to the fact that many tasks may be bundled into a single batch job.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TerminateContext​(java.lang.String batchID, java.lang.String streamName, java.lang.String streamLocation, PlatformProperties platformProps)
      Creates a request to terminate the job with the given batch ID.

      static java.util.List<TerminateContext> create​(java.lang.String batchID, java.lang.String streamName, java.lang.String streamLocation, PlatformProperties platformProps)
      Creates a list containing a single terminate context with the given values
      java.lang.String getBatchID()
      gets the batchID to terminate
      java.lang.Throwable getFailureCause()
      if the termination requested by this context fails due to an exception then this should return that exception.
      java.lang.String getFailureStatus()
      if the termination requested by this context fails and the job should be reported as a different status then this should return a string containing that status.
      PlatformProperties getPlatformProps()
      gets a PlatformProperties object describing the platform on which the job was submitted.
      java.lang.String getResultMessage()
      If this context is a failure then this method should return a String containing a description of why.
      java.lang.String getStreamLocation()
      gets a String containing the location of the parent stream
      java.lang.String getStreamName()
      gets a String containing the name of the parent stream
      boolean isFailure()
      returns true if the termination of this context's job failed
      void setFailure​(boolean failure)
      Sets the failure status of this context's job.
      void setFailureCause​(java.lang.Throwable failureCause)
      if the termination requested by this context fails due to an exception then this should be called to store that exception.
      void setFailureStatus​(java.lang.String failureStatus)
      if the termination requested by this context fails and the job should be reported as a different status then this should be called to set that status.
      void setResultMessage​(java.lang.String failureMessage)
      If this context is a failure then this method should be called to set a description of why.

      • TerminateContext

        public TerminateContext​(java.lang.String batchID,
                        java.lang.String streamName,
                        java.lang.String streamLocation,
                        PlatformProperties platformProps)
        Creates a request to terminate the job with the given batch ID.
        Parameters:
        batchID - a String containing the batch ID of the job to terminate
        streamName - a String containing the name of the parent stream
        streamLocation - a String containing the location of the parent stream
        platformProps - a PlatformProperties object describing the platform on which the job was submitted.
